briefdescription.para: 0 for false; 1 for true. Performs computations without use of symmetries if true. Useful for debugging purposes.

briefdescription.para: 0 for false; 1 for true. If true, Anderson acceleration is used to converge parquet iterations and self-energy iterations in mfRG faster.
0 for false; 1 for true. If true, temperature T = 0 is assumed.

memberdef.name: KELDYSH_FORMALISM

briefdescription.para: Determines whether calculations shall be done in the Keldysh or Matsubara formalism. 0 for Matsubara; 1 for Keldysh formalism.

briefdescription.para: 0 for false; 1 for true. If true, the sum over internal Keldysh indices is done before the frequency integration. Recommended setting: 1.

memberdef.name: VECTORIZED_INTEGRATION

briefdescription.para: 0 for false; 1 for true. If true, integrals are performed with vector-valued integrands. For Keldysh, vectorization over Keldysh indices. For Matsubara at finite T, vectorization over the Matsubara sum.

briefdescription.para: Production runs parameters ///.

detaileddescription.para: Defines the diagrammatic classes that will be considered: 1 for only K1, 2 for K1 and K2 and 3 for the full dependencies. Useful for debugging purposes and for computations in second order perturbation theory, which only require K1.

briefdescription.para: If defined, the Katanin extension is used during mfRG computations.
0 for false; 1 for true. If true, corrections to the flow equations for the vertex from the self-energy, starting at l=3, are included.
fRG parameters ///
If true, detailed information about all computational steps are written into the log file. Recommended setting for production runs: false.
Physical parameters ///.

detaileddescription.para: Chemical potential w.l.o.g. ALWAYS set to 0.0 for the AM!

briefdescription.para: Bias voltage (glb_V == 0. in equilibrium)

memberdef.name: EQUILIBRIUM

briefdescription.para: If true, use equilibrium FDT's for propagators.

briefdescription.para: Initial value of the regulator \Lambda for an mfRG flow.
Final value of the regulator \Lambda for an mfRG flow.
Scale of the log substitution, relevant in the hybridization flow.
Initial step size for ODE solvers with adaptive step size control.

Vector with the values of U in units of \Delta that an mfRG flow should cover. Serve as checkpoints for the flow. Useful for benchmarking purposes if data from other methods at precise parameter points are available.
